topic.title: Installing on Windows
topic.shortdesc: You can install Couchbase Server on machines running Windows operating systems.

body.note: Before installing, verify the list of supported operating systems. Both 32 bit and 64 bit systems are supported. However, be aware that Windows versions 7 and 8 are supported only for development purposes.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: To install Couchbase Server on Windows, make sure that you have the following prerequisites:

ol.li: There is no anti-virus software is running on the machine before you start the installation process.
You have administrator privileges on the machine where you are performing the installation.

By default, TCP/IP has the default number of ports available for client communication. Follow the information provided in MSDN: Avoiding TCP/IP Port Exhaustion. Avoiding TCP/IP Port Exhaustion to adjust the configuration and increase the number of available ports.

By default on Windows does not provide an adequate number of ephemeral ports for Couchbase clusters. Without the correct number of open ephemeral ports, you can experience errors during rebalancing, timeouts on clients, and failed backups. The Couchbase Server installer will automatically check for your current port setting and adjust it if needed. See Microsoft KB-196271.

section.note: Couchbase Server uses the Microsoft C++ redistributable package, which is automatically downloaded during installation. However, if another application on your machine is already using the package, your installation process can fail. To make sure that your installation process completes successfully, shut down all other running applications during installation. For Windows 2008, you must upgrade your Windows Server 2008 R2 installation with Service Pack 1 installed before running Couchbase Server. You can obtain Service Pack 1 from Microsoft TechNet.
